channel.title: Webclient Stuck At "Loading..." [Solved: Had To Resign My Jar]
channel.description:
I just finished making my auto cache downloader, jarring and signing my client, and now it's time to upload it to my website! Here are the files I uploaded to the website. [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2i78z6c.jpg[/img] The client.jar works perfectly fine when I just open it like normal, and the HTML code I used flawless. I'm beginning to feel it's something to do with the client files themselves. This is the code for my index.html that I used. [CODE] Project Crid

Project Crid Forums
Anything Here! [/CODE] With this all uploaded to my website, when I go to it, all it loads is this. [IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/2u88q2p.jpg[/img] You can try for yourself at http://projectcridplay.net84.net/index.html absolutely any help is appreciated greatly, thanks so much for reading this. P.S. If you need any more information about my problem that might help you help me fix it, I'd be more than happy to post it.

item.title: Webclient Stuck At "Loading..." [Solved: Had To Resign My Jar]
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“iRobertTM, post:7, topic:528085”]Yes, my jar auto downloads the cache and runs perfectly. :(([/quote]strange…I still think it’s something on the site side

item.title: Webclient Stuck At "Loading..." [Solved: Had To Resign My Jar]
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

The character encoding of the page must be declared in the document

I’m no web developer by any means but I assume that’s referring to putting the meta type for like utf etc?Either way the error confirms it has to do with the html document itself not the actual jar

Edit: this may be useful to you

http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-html-encoding-declarations

Read full topic
item.source: Webclient Stuck At "Loading..." [Solved: Had To Resign My Jar]

item.title: Webclient Stuck At "Loading..." [Solved: Had To Resign My Jar]
item.dc:creator: @iRobertTM iRobertTM
item.description:
@iRobertTM wrote:

[12:34:56.692] The character encoding of the HTML document was not declared. The document will render with garbled text in some browser configurations if the document contains characters from outside the US-ASCII range. The character encoding of the page must be declared in the document or in the transfer protocol. @ http://projectcridplay.net84.net/index.html

Read full topic
item.source: Webclient Stuck At "Loading..." [Solved: Had To Resign My Jar]

item.source: Webclient Stuck At "Loading..." [Solved: Had To Resign My Jar]

item.title: Webclient Stuck At "Loading..." [Solved: Had To Resign My Jar]
item.dc:creator: @iRobertTM iRobertTM
item.description:
@iRobertTM wrote:

I just finished making my auto cache downloader, jarring and signing my client, and now it’s time to upload it to my website! Here are the files I uploaded to the website.

2i78z6c.jpg985×406

The client.jar works perfectly fine when I just open it like normal, and the HTML code I used flawless. I’m beginning to feel it’s something to do with the client files themselves. This is the code for my index.html that I used.

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Project Crid</TITLE>
<body bgcolor="black">
<META HTTP-EQUIV="PRAGMA" CONTENT="NO-CACHE">
</HEAD>

<BODY>
<center>
<applet name="Project Crid" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class">
<param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m">
</applet>
<p>
<font color="white"><b>Project Crid</b> <I>

<a href="http://projectcrid.freeforum.bz">Forums</a>
</br>
Anything Here!
</I></font>

</BODY>
</HTML>

With this all uploaded to my website, when I go to it, all it loads is this.

2u88q2p.jpg790×768

You can try for yourself at http://projectcridplay.net84.net/index.html absolutely any help is appreciated greatly, thanks so much for reading this.

P.S. If you need any more information about my problem that might help you help me fix it, I’d be more than happy to post it.

Read full topic
item.source: Webclient Stuck At "Loading..." [Solved: Had To Resign My Jar]
